metadata.title: 5 things to know: Monday, June 2
metadata.description: CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin reports on the 5 things to know from June 2, 2025.

transcript.full_text: Five things to know ahead of today's opening bell. Lawmakers return to work this week. The Senate set to take up the reconciliation bill. Republican Senator Ron Johnson says he's going to insist on deeper spending cuts to address the debt burden. Meantime, the Trump administration's push to cut government costs has expanded from consulting firms, now to technology companies. The Wall Street Journal reporting that officials sent a letter to 10 tech firms last week. Those include Dell and IT firm CDW. They're asking executives to justify their work and to find areas to cut. Meantime, Ukraine says it destroyed dozens of Russian war planes in a clandestine drone attack on Russia's long-range bomber fleet. The attack coming as delegations from Russia and Ukraine are set to meet today in Istanbul for negotiations for a ceasefire. And New York Airport is going to be reopening a closed runway today. It happens today. It has contributed to weeks of delays and chaos. The FAA evaluated the repairs to the runway and deemed it safe. The work was completed 13 days ahead of schedule, a rarity. Uh and at the weekend box office, uh Disney's uh Lilo and Stitch, uh bringing in $63 million becoming the second highest grossing movie of the year behind the Minecraft movie. It has now sold $280 million in tickets in the US and Canada.

analysis.summary:
Ahead of today's opening bell, several key developments are unfolding across different sectors. In politics, lawmakers are back at work this week, with the Senate prepared to take up the reconciliation bill. Republican Senator Ron Johnson is advocating for more significant spending cuts to address the national debt. Concurrently, the Trump administration's cost-cutting initiatives have expanded beyond consulting firms to include technology companies; the Wall Street Journal reports that ten tech firms, including Dell and CDW, received letters last week requesting justification for their work and identification of potential cuts.

On the international stage, Ukraine has claimed responsibility for a clandestine drone attack that reportedly destroyed numerous Russian warplanes, specifically targeting Russia's long-range bomber fleet. This significant event precedes a crucial meeting scheduled for today in Istanbul, where delegations from Russia and Ukraine are set to engage in negotiations for a ceasefire.

Domestically, a New York Airport is preparing to reopen a previously closed runway today. The closure of this runway had contributed to weeks of significant delays and operational disruptions. The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has assessed the completed repairs, deeming the runway safe for use, and notably, the work was completed thirteen days ahead of its projected schedule.

Finally, in entertainment news, Disney's 'Lilo and Stitch' performed well at the weekend box office, grossing $63 million. This performance positions it as the second highest-grossing movie of the year, trailing only the 'Minecraft movie.' 'Lilo and Stitch' has accumulated $280 million in ticket sales across the US and Canada to date.

key_points.text: Lawmakers are returning to work this week, with the Senate set to address the reconciliation bill.
Republican Senator Ron Johnson intends to demand deeper spending cuts to alleviate the debt burden.
The Trump administration's effort to reduce government costs has broadened to include technology companies.
The Wall Street Journal reported that officials sent letters to 10 tech firms last week.
The tech firms that received letters include Dell and IT firm CDW.
Executives from these firms are being asked to justify their work and identify areas for cost reduction.
Ukraine claims to have destroyed dozens of Russian war planes in a clandestine drone attack.
The drone attack targeted Russia's long-range bomber fleet.
This attack occurs as delegations from Russia and Ukraine are scheduled to meet today in Istanbul.
The meeting in Istanbul is for negotiations aimed at a ceasefire.
A New York Airport is set to reopen a previously closed runway today.
The closed runway had significantly contributed to weeks of delays and chaos at the airport.
The FAA evaluated the runway repairs and officially deemed it safe for use.
The repair work on the runway was completed 13 days ahead of schedule.
At the weekend box office, Disney's 'Lilo and Stitch' earned $63 million.
'Lilo and Stitch' is now the second highest-grossing movie of the year.
The 'Minecraft movie' remains the highest-grossing movie of the year, ahead of 'Lilo and Stitch'.
Total ticket sales for 'Lilo and Stitch' in the US and Canada have reached $280 million.

dates.context: Five things to know ahead of today's opening bell
Lawmakers return to work this week
officials sent a letter to 10 tech firms last week
delegations from Russia and Ukraine are set to meet today in Istanbul
New York Airport is going to be reopening a closed runway today. It happens today.

timeline_events.event_description: Lawmakers are returning to work this week.
The Senate is set to take up the reconciliation bill this week.
Republican Senator Ron Johnson insists on deeper spending cuts to address debt burden.
The Trump administration's push to cut government costs has expanded from consulting firms to technology companies.
Officials sent a letter to 10 tech firms last week, as reported by The Wall Street Journal.
Ukraine claims to have destroyed dozens of Russian war planes in a clandestine drone attack on Russia's long-range bomber fleet.
Delegations from Russia and Ukraine are set to meet today in Istanbul for ceasefire negotiations.
A closed runway at a New York Airport is reopening today after contributing to weeks of delays and chaos.
The FAA evaluated repairs to the New York Airport runway and deemed it safe prior to its reopening.
Repair work on the New York Airport runway was completed 13 days ahead of schedule.
Disney's Lilo and Stitch earned $63 million at the recent weekend box office.
Lilo and Stitch has cumulatively sold $280 million in tickets in the US and Canada, becoming the second highest grossing movie of the year.

temporal_patterns.description: The Trump administration's cost-cutting initiative shows a progression, expanding from targeting consulting firms to now including technology companies.
temporal_patterns.significance: Expansion of policy scope over time.

temporal_patterns.description: A sequence of events related to the New York Airport runway: closure leading to weeks of delays, followed by FAA evaluation, completion of repairs 13 days ahead of schedule, and its reopening today.
temporal_patterns.significance: Resolution of an issue; efficiency of repair work.

temporal_patterns.description: The reported drone attack by Ukraine on Russian warplanes is a recent event occurring in proximity to, and possibly influencing, scheduled ceasefire negotiations between Russia and Ukraine today.
temporal_patterns.significance: Indication of ongoing conflict influencing diplomatic efforts.

temporal_patterns.description: The box office performance of Disney's Lilo and Stitch demonstrates a financial progression, with a significant weekend earning ($63 million) contributing to a larger cumulative total ($280 million) up to the current point.
